title: Trams in Magdeburg
text:
The Magdeburg tramway network () is a <a href="transport%20network">network</a> of <a href="tram">tram</a>ways forming part of the <a href="public%20transport">public transport</a> system in <a href="Magdeburg">Magdeburg</a>, the capital city of the <a href="States%20of%20Germany">federal state</a> of <a href="Saxony-Anhalt">Saxony-Anhalt</a>, Germany.
Opened in 1877, the network has been operated since 1999 by (MVB), and is integrated in the (marego).
Rolling stock.
The fleet of the Magdeburg tram network consists of 83 <a href="Linke-Hofmann-Busch">LHB</a> low-floor trams, 8 <a href="Tatra%20KT4">Tatra KT4Dmod</a> trams, 4 <a href="Tatra%20T6A2">Tatra T6A2M</a> trams and 13 B6A2M trailers. A tender for 35 new trams is planned, with deliveries scheduled to begin in 2022.
For assistance in case of a derailment, for <a href="Derailment%23Rerailing">rerailing</a> and for hauling defective trams, the MVB uses a modified <a href="Unimog">Unimog</a> <a href="road%E2%80%93rail%20vehicle">road–rail vehicle</a> with a lengthened wheelbase of 4,500mm and a power output of 240 PS.
